meanings.definition: To pause before saying or doing something.
meanings.sent1: I always hesitate before answering a difficult question.
meanings.sent2: Don't hesitate to ask for help if you need it.
meanings.sent3: Why do you hesitate to press the big red button?
meanings.sent4: She hesitated like a deer caught in headlights.
meanings.sent5: The decision was so important that he couldn't hesitate for even a second.

meanings.sent1: He tends to hesitate when trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: She might hesitate to join the club without knowing anyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to hesitate before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His heart hesitated, unsure of what to do next.
meanings.sent5: The student hesitated at the edge of the diving board, unsure of the water below.
